Classic

[h1] Время, доктор Фримен? Неужели опять пришло то самое время? [/h1]

[b] Half-Life 2: Episode One [/b] — небольшой аддон к [b] Half-Life 2 [/b], повествующий о приключениях Гордона Фримена и Аликс Вэнс, произошедших сразу после событий второй части.

Игра практически не изменилась за два года, в ней появились немного улучшенные визуальные эффекты, световые пакеты, электрощитки, вентили и зомбайны. Всё остальное осталось неизменным.

Аддон обязателен для прохождения всем сразу после знакомства с [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/dele1996/recommended/220/] Half-Life 2 [/url]. Эта часть исправила мелкие недостатки игры - предшественницы и заслужила максимальную оценку.

Моя оценка: 10 из 10
A fun extension of the original game.  Lots of pulse pounding action, tight spaces, and physics oriented puzzles.
A great follow up story to Half Life 2 to where it stopped. It's a bit short but it's worth playing along with Episode 2.

Продолжение отличное,как и сама оригинальная игра. Мое мнение положительное,за исключением одного момента.Под конец игры,на ж/д вокзале надо будет сразиться со страйдером.Так вот,тот кто такую идиотскую базуку в игре придумиал,чтоб тебе руки Гейб оторвал. Стоит страйдер в 20 метрах,Выстреливаю прямо,но вместо того,чтобы попасть в него,ракета тут же меняет траекторию,разворачивается и меня убивает.Вот вопрос:с какого прототипа (из реального оружия) базука была сделана? Автор базуки аутист какой-то.И на страйдере нет ни какой противо ракетной защиты(это вам не батла).Оценка за потраченные нервы 10.5/10

HL2のエンディング直後から始まる今で言うスタンドアロンDLCのようなもの。光源まわりや顔の表情がHL2に比べると改善されている。
今回はフリーマン単独じゃなく、前作にも出てきたレジスタンスのリーダー「アリックス」と常に一緒に行動するので半ばBioshock:
Infiniteの元ネタのように感じた。実績の「一撃必殺」（銃未使用縛り）取得のためメインの火力はアリックス頼り、プレイヤーであるフリーマンはグラビティガンで物を投げつけたり障害物を排除するのが主なプレイスタイルになる。アリックスのAIはかなり賢いしほぼ不死身なので、プレイヤーが暗闇でライトを照らしたり、照準先を示してフォローしたりHL2とは同じ世界観でもだいぶプレイ感覚が違ってきている。
ゲームのボリュームはHL2の1/4程度に感じられた。崩壊しつつ有るCity17から市民を援護しつつ列車で脱出する話なのでシンプルなストーリーといえばシンプル。なるべくHL2のクリアから間を置かずにプレイするのがオススメ。フリーマンの相棒であるバールの登場がかなり後半なのは残念。

My review for Half-Life 2 can be seen here:
http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198056186683/recommended/220

It's good, damn good but it's not as good as Half-Life 2 or Episode 2. This has got some damn good atmosphere and combat sequnces and while short stands tall as an excellent adventure amongst FPS titles and expansions. That said it really is the middle child of the Half-Life 2 family. From replaying I've come to think it's real weaknesses come from it's exposition heavy,slow start and opening Citadel chapters. Especially when  all combined. It has you teamed up with Alyx for the entire episode and thankfully she is well written, helpful and interesting and a damn impressive showcase of AI unlike a certain Sheva. 

At the same time though you'll often be locked into what I call little "cutscene" rooms. YES you can move around freely as control is never taken away from the player in the Half-Life games but while these "cutscenes" as well written and interesting as they are are also unskipable and if it's not your first time playing all you can do is leap around like a fussy cat and make people look like an idiot as you attempt to jump on their head or find something to throw. The tunnels, and ESPECIALLY the remains of City 17 are when it's best. The Citadel isn't bad, FAR FROM IT, but it wasn't my favorite part on repeat playthroughs and it keeps me from speedily progressing to my favorite parts faster if I don't skip massive chunks of the gamet via chapter select that is.

Episode 1 does a lot of things scripting and scenario wise that I've never seen all together in one single FPS game before especially in terms of it's design and layout but then it will repeat some of these good parts a little too much and as a cherry on top will have a character openly say "oh god no", "not again" and "here we go again" winkingly as you do a reocurring scripted sequence involving Combine, explosives and doors. 

Having a character remark at how over used a gimmick in game is and then DOING the gimmick anyway does not then excuse or fix the gimmick. It sticks out like a sore thumb as this sort of thing is uncommon in the game prior. It's like when Duke in Duke Nukem Forever sighed in disgust at a literal pipe puzzle and said "I hate Valve puzzles." and then proceeding to do it anyway. (And no I am not saying anything in this game is as bad as any part of the Duke Nukem Forever.)

It's short (real short) but sweet and unless you don't wan't to wait forever for a conclusion after you play Episode 2 I highly reccomend you play Episode 1.

하프라이프 2 이후의 이야기를 다룬 게임으로, 볼륨은 DLC 급으로 짧습니다.


[*주의 : 밑에 '하프라이프 2'의 스포가 있습니다. '하프라이프 2 에피소드 1'의 스포는 없습니다.]




하프라이프 2에서 코어를 파괴한 이후 알릭스와 함께 17번 지구를 탈출하는 내용이 주가 되는 게임입니다.
기본적인 면에서는 하프라이프 2와 별로 달라진 건 없습니다. 조작, 컨텐츠, 등장 인물, 무기 등등 거의 다 2와 같습니다.
그래도 역시 하프라이프는 하프라이프이기 때문에 굉장히 재밌게 플레이했습니다.
초반에 플래시 없이는 아무것도 안 보이는 구간만 제외하면 무난하게 플레이 가능합니다.
그런데 총 안 쓰고 쓰는 도전과제를 하신다면 좀 답답하실 수도 있습니다. 전 총 쏘고 싶은 욕구를 참아가며 겨우겨우 도전과제를 깼습니다만, 도전과제 별로 신경 안 쓰시는 분은 이거 하지 마세요. 답답해 죽습니다. ㅋㅋ
마지막으로 또 하나, 바로 다음에 에피소드 2가 있어서 그런지 별다른 임팩트 없이 게임이 평범하게 끝난 거 같아서 아쉽네요.

Episode One is a very short mini-sequel to Half Life 2. It was very fun but quick. Very nice addon to the story and felt just like Half Life 2. Not much to say than I recommend it.

8/10

Episode one is a whirlwind of action, from beginning to end. You wake up from an explosion and a bigger explosion is the last thing you see before the credits roll. The gravity gun figures prominantly, which is great. Lots of interior shots of the Citadel, then a crazy City 17 escape. A must have for anyone with Half-Life 2.

Almost everything to say about Half life 2 has been said.  Here's a quick run down for the game.

You will see an environment that still looks pleasing and immersive, however it age begins to show in some spots.  You will have a decent selection of weapons, and a group of characters you will actually grow fond of overtime.  You will encounter a selection of enemies, but they do tend to get a little repetitive towards the end.  You even have plenty of props to play with either using your hands, or the gravity gun.

Now, don't let all the cult praise get the better of you though.  There are still issues with the game.  Mentioned before, the age of the game is starting to show in some parts.  The ladder system is a little buggy at times, and the game is a little tedious in some parts.  But its a small price to pay for a game that does offer a good story to keep the player engaged as you go on.  As someone who hasn't played Half life till 2015, I can safely tell you your money will be well spent.  However, save a few bucks and get The Orange Box for this game and its two follow-up episodes.

Gordon Freeman. Half Life evreninin baş kahramanı. Seninle yeniden buluşmak inan beni ne kadar mutlu ediyor anlatamam. Hikayeye kaldığımız yerden devam ediyoruz. Amacımız City 17 den kaçmak.Oyun boyunca yanımızda Alyx var. Bizi hiç yanlız bırakmıyor. Oyunda en çok kullanacağınız silah yine Gravity Gun oluyor. Fizik motoru yine çok iyi. Oyun sonunda yine bir çok merak edilen konu havada kalıyor. Müzik ve seslendirmeler çok iyi. Bulmacalar diğer oyunlara göre çok az. Çünkü oyun beş bölümden oluşuyor ve kısa sürüyor. Oynanış olarak da Half Life 2 den aşağı kalır yanı yok.

★ SONUÇ ★

Half-Life 2: Episode One is yet another single-player FPS from Valve that came out in 2006 year. It's a direct continuation to Half-Life 2 and supposedly a start of episodic releases. If forget that it never got past Episode Two. Episodic releases of games just never work, unless you are Telltale.

It's quite similiar to Half-Life 2 and uses game design philosophy behind it, as well as gameplay. And assets. So there isn't much to explain. A fancy shooter with gravigun. Only this time you often has a teammate, Alyx, who doesn't die easily.

Plotwise it continues where Half-Life 2 ends, as you are found in rumbles of a citadel of City 17. Now it's your mission to get out from city and cause trouble for yourself in meanwhile.

It starts out quite weak, as you have to venture through some amount of storyline scenes and then left with super-charged gravigun. Super-charged gravigun was quite a nice surprise at the end of Half-Life 2, but here it overstays it's welcome, as it's the only weapon you can use, with no variety.

It gets better after first two chapter, as you slowly gain standard weapons, find much more creative uses for gravigun and will get to enjoy Alyx's fighting company much more, while you are exploring dark underground, ruins of a city and hospital. Hospital also featured some AI vs AI fights, something that me and many players love watching. And boss. Same old in new enviroment.

Episode One adds a big new feature in Valve games for first time: Developers commentary.
When activated, the flying icons will appear in the levels that you can use. Upon usage you will be listening (and reading in subtitles) to one of the developers talking about something related or unrelated to where the icon was placed. It could be Alyx's AI, or changes in lighting, or the way that scene came to be, or just how smart they count themselves.
It's quite a great addition and is much better than Developer Commentaries in later Valve games, which was more like Voice Acting Commentary: How Amazing It Is To Have No Script.

Overall, it's a decent FPS. Decent episode. Something that you will beat, have fun and then forget. Still nice.
Отличное продолжение самой лучшей игры !

As usual , Valve has another amazing game on its hands. It always baffles me that they can create a game that is visually impressive and run amazingly smooth even on the lowest of the settings. The story is great; some lovely, touching moments, and some hilarious ones (here's looking at you Dr Kleiner) and keeps all the same characters you run into along the way. Definitely a great game and segway into the next one (episode 2). Plus the achievements are not too hard to get (can play on easy), especially since you can save where ever and as often as you like.  
10/10 
keep doing what your doing valve! :)

Half-Life 2 on reverse. And shorter.

PROS:
- Alyx's improved combat AI 
- The Hospital level

CONS:
- Only a few brief segments alone

- Rehashed environments

Хоть эпизод и короткий, но за то в нём стало больше захватывающих моментов, диалогов с Аликс, новых врагов, улучшенной мимики лица, а также улучшение искусственного интеллекта, как у врагов, так и у Аликс. Также произошли некоторые изменения в графике, которые оставляют незабываемые впечатления! Рекомендую к прохождению! Не проходите мимо!
